001package edu.cnm.deepdive.uno.service;
002
003import android.content.Context;
004import android.content.Intent;
005import android.util.Log;
006import androidx.activity.result.ActivityResult;
007import androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultLauncher;
008import com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignIn;
009import com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount;
010import com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInClient;
011import com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInOptions;
012import com.google.android.gms.common.api.ApiException;
013import com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task;
014import dagger.hilt.android.qualifiers.ApplicationContext;
015import edu.cnm.deepdive.uno.R;
016import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Completable;
017import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Single;
018import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.SingleEmitter;
019import io.reactivex.rxjava3.schedulers.Schedulers;
020import javax.inject.Inject;
021import javax.inject.Singleton;
022
023/**
024 * Service for handling Google Sign-In operations.
025 */
026@Singleton
027public class GoogleSignInService {
028
029  private static final String TAG = GoogleSignInService.class.getSimpleName();
030  private static final String BEARER_TOKEN_FORMAT = "Bearer %s";
031
032  private final GoogleSignInClient client;
033
034  /**
035   * Constructs an instance of GoogleSignInService used to handel Google sign-in operations.
036   *
037   * @param context The application's context.
038   */
039  @Inject
040  GoogleSignInService(@ApplicationContext Context context) {
041    String clientId = context.getString(R.string.client_id);
042    GoogleSignInOptions options = new GoogleSignInOptions.Builder()
043        .requestEmail()
044        .requestId()
045        .requestProfile()
046        .requestIdToken(clientId)
047        .build();
048    client = GoogleSignIn.getClient(context, options);
049  }
050
051  /**
052   * Performs a silentSignIn and logs the associated bearer token.
053   *
054   * @return RxJava Single of GoogleSignInAccount.
055   */
056  public Single<GoogleSignInAccount> refresh() {
057    return Single.create((SingleEmitter<GoogleSignInAccount> emitter) ->
058            client
059                .silentSignIn()
060                .addOnSuccessListener(emitter::onSuccess)
061                .addOnSuccessListener((account) -> {
062                  Log.d(TAG, account.getIdToken());
063                }) // FIXME: 7/2/24 Remove ASAP
064                .addOnFailureListener(emitter::onError)
065        )
066        .observeOn(Schedulers.io());
067  }
068
069  /**
070   * Refreshes the sign-in bearer token.
071   *
072   * @return RxJava Single containing the bearer token.
073   */
074  public Single<String> refreshToken() {
075    return refresh()
076        .map((account) -> String.format(BEARER_TOKEN_FORMAT, account.getIdToken()));
077  }
078
079  /**
080   * Kicks-off the Google sign-in process.
081   *
082   * @param launcher An ActivityResultLauncher used to launch the sign-in process.
083   */
084  public void startSignIn(ActivityResultLauncher<Intent> launcher) {
085    launcher.launch(client.getSignInIntent());
086  }
087
088  /**
089   * Completes the sign-in process.
090   *
091   * @param result the ActivityResult
092   * @return RxJava Single that emits the signed in GoogleSignInAccount.
093   */
094  public Single<GoogleSignInAccount> completeSignIn(ActivityResult result) {
095    return Single.create((SingleEmitter<GoogleSignInAccount> emitter) -> {
096          try {
097            Task<GoogleSignInAccount> task = GoogleSignIn.getSignedInAccountFromIntent(
098                result.getData());
099            GoogleSignInAccount account = task.getResult(ApiException.class);
100            Log.d(TAG, account.getIdToken());
101            emitter.onSuccess(account);
102          } catch (ApiException e) {
103            emitter.onError(e);
104          }
105        })
106        .observeOn(Schedulers.io());
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * Handles signing a user out of the application.
111   *
112   * @return A RxJava Completable which indicates the user has been signed out.
113   */
114  public Completable signOut() {
115    return Completable.create((emitter) ->
116        client
117            .signOut()
118            .addOnSuccessListener((ignored) -> emitter.onComplete())
119            .addOnFailureListener(emitter::onError)
120    ).observeOn(Schedulers.io());
121  }
122
123}
